titleStmt.title: The humble petition and declaration of both Houses of Parliament to the Kings most excellent Majesty: sent to Yorke, by one Lord and two members of the House of Commons on Wednesday the 23. of March. 1641. : In answer to every particular of His Majesties speech at New-market which hee made to the committee of both Houses when they presented the last declaration. : With their additionall information received from the governour of Roterdam ...
titleStmt.author: England and Wales. Parliament.

titleStmt.title: The humble petition and declaration of both Houses of Parliament to the Kings most excellent Majesty: sent to Yorke, by one Lord and two members of the House of Commons on Wednesday the 23. of March. 1641. : In answer to every particular of His Majesties speech at New-market which hee made to the committee of both Houses when they presented the last declaration. : With their additionall information received from the governour of Roterdam ...
titleStmt.author: England and Wales. Parliament.
England and Wales. Sovereign (1625-1649 : Charles I) His Majesties answer to the petition of both Houses of Parliament.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed for F. Coules, and T. Bates.,

notesStmt.note: "His Majesties answer to the petition of both Houses of Parliament / presented to him at York on Saturday the 26 of March, 1642 ..."--P. 7.
Reproduction of original in: Bodleian Library.
